top_categories.workout_context: Race-pace efforts that mimic Grasshopper Adventure Series' demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before January.
Grasshopper Adventure Series' diverse - gravel roads, logging roads, forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 70 miles.
When someone attacks on diverse - gravel roads, logging roads,, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
64ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
At Grasshopper Adventure Series, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Grasshopper Adventure Series, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Grasshopper Adventure Series. Train it until it feels boring.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on diverse - gravel roads, logging roads,. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
70 miles on diverse - gravel roads, logging roads, burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
Varied gradients on diverse - gravel roads, logging roads, demand climbing versatility. Sit the shallow stuff, stand the steep stuff, switch without thinking.
Low-cadence force work for 4,500ft of climbing. The slow, grinding ascents where you can't spin—you push.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 4,500ft of climbing on diverse - gravel roads, logging roads, does to your power file on race day.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Grasshopper Adventure Series’s 70 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Grasshopper Adventure Series. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
